revision.text: ==Old Spanish== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|osp|xaa|-}}, from {{der|osp|ar|شَقِيقَة}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|osp|/ʃaˈkeka/}} ===Noun=== {{osp-noun|f}} # [[migraine]] #* '''c. 1250''', [[w:Alfonso X|Alfonso X]], ''Lapidario'', f. 8r. #*: Et a tal uertud que tuelle la dolor que ſe faze en la media cabeça aq́ llaman en arauigo '''xaq́ca'''. ¬ en latin migranea. #*:: And its virtue is such that it alleviates the pain felt in the middle of the head, called '''''xaqueca''''' [migraine] in Arabic and ''migranea'' in Latin. <!--Note that the author is not really providing the actual Arabic or Latin terms for “migraine,” but rather presenting two Old Spanish terms, the first the Arabic-derived ''jaqueca'' and the second a Latinate spelling of the Latin/Greek-derived ''migranna'' (in Late Latin actually ''hēmicrānia''), as equivalents.--> ====Descendants==== * {{desc|es|jaqueca}}
